intro: Lappula rattanii, commonly known as the slender lappula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions, often found in meadows and along streambanks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive hairy texture. Lappula rattanii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
